NASCAR - Always a blast!
Oct 2024 • Solo
Third NASCAR event here for me...
The facility is great. I personally recommend using transportation, rather than driving. The motor coaches get out much quicker than other traffic.
Bring a seat pad !
Only complaint is the food/drink pricing... Check the rules... there are some items that are allowed... if possible bring your own ice and drinks. Re-entry was allowed, so going back to the motot coach was allowed. They were parked really close to the entrance, and this was convenient for going back and forth.

133 contributions
4 lane drag strip, you will feel the race in your chest!
Apr 2024 • Couples
Amazing 3 day NHRA event! It is important to bring sun screen, 64oz insulated water bottle, hat, and jacket because the wind picks up, and it cools down quickly as the shade sets in later in the day. At 66 degrees, you will get a sunburn. The reserved seating area has easy access to rest rooms as well as food and beverage options. There are plenty of golf carts available to take those with mobility issues from the gate to the stands.

Front row seating is a waste of money
Oct 2023 • Family
Purchased tickets in the front row, right by the finish line for NASCAR weekend. While overall the venue was good the moments in the race that you wait for were blocked by people standing in front at the fence. Very little control was implemented at this venue. Don’t bother buying the good seats, just get kind of close then walk up and block everyone else’s view at the big moments! These pictures were my front row view at the finish of the race. Las Vegas Speedway, do better!

Written January 22, 2019
Tami H
15 contributions
I was lucky - we had a relative in town with their car, so I can say we had a chauffeur! Access is pretty easy - the track itself is located on the northeast edge of Vegas, between the Interstate and Nellis AFB. There are entrances and exits from both sides. I lived in Vegas for a time, so I was comfortable with driving and navigating. The police did indeed do a great job of directing and managing traffic inflow and outflow. Your driving time depends completely on where you are. We stayed on the east side of town, at the Boulder Station, giving us a short straight shot north to the track - early enough to avoid the heavy traffic - maybe 20 minutes and we were there. You have to choose for yourself whether to rent a car, depend upon a busy taxi/Uber/Lyft or take the bus. Depends upon how familiar you are with the area and how confident you feel about driving in Vegas. We went about 1 1/2 hrs before the race - gave us time to visit the vendors, buy some swag, play with power tools, enjoy a sandwich and chat with the Blue Angels pilots. It was a blast and I highly recommend going! I will go again soon...
Written January 28, 2019
Voyager09263966249
